column2: Change in HICP-based annual inflation rate, 1996-2013
Harmonized Indexes of Consumer Prices (HICP), percentage point change in inflation from the previous year

column1: Note: The HICP is an internationally comparable measure of consumer price inflation.
Underlying HICPs are from the national statistical agencies of the countries compared and from the European Commission (Eurostat). Inflation rates are calculated by The Conference Board.
For more information, see Technical Notes and
Source: The Conference Board, International Labor Comparisons program
